com.adonax.audiocue

Class AudioCueInstanceEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adonax.audiocue.AudioCueInstanceEvent

  • public class AudioCueInstanceEvent
extends java.lang.Object
    The AudioCueInstanceEvent class represents an event in the life cycle of an AudioCue instance. An AudioCueInstanceEvent is passed as an argument to every class that implements the AudioCueListener interface and is registered to receive notifications about instance events.

    An AudioCue supports concurrent plays of its media, where the maximum number of concurrent plays is equal to the value held in the final variable AudioCue.polyphony. Each concurrent play is referred to as an instance. Instance events mark the life cycle of a single playing or playable instance as follows:

    • OBTAIN_INSTANCE: an instance is obtained from the pool of available instances if the limit of allocated concurrent instances is not exceeded
    • START_INSTANCE: an instance starts to play
    • LOOP: a instance that finishes playing restarts from the beginning
    • STOP_INSTANCE: a playing instance is stopped (but can still be restarted)
    • RELEASE_INSTANCE: an instance is released back into the pool of available instances.

    The information packaged in the AudioCueInstanceEvent is contained in the following immutable fields:

    • type - an enum designating the nature of the event
    • time - a long containing the time of occurrence of the event, to the nearest millisecond
    • source - the originating AudioCue
    • frame - a double containing the sample frame (may be fractional) current at the time of the event
    • instanceID - an int used to identify the AudioCue instance.
    Version:
    AudioCue 1.1
    Author:
    Philip Freihofner
    See Also:
    http://adonax.com/AudioCue

        public AudioCueInstanceEvent(AudioCueInstanceEvent.Type type,

        Parameters:
        type - an enum that designates the category of AudioCue instance event
        source - the AudioCue that is the origin of the event
        instanceID - an int hook used to identify the AudioCue instance
        frame - a double that holds the sample frame current at the time of the event
